citation.article-title: Aquitalea denitrificans sp. nov., isolated from a Korean wetland.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aquitalea denitrificans sp. nov.
Aquitalea denitrificans (de.ni.tri′fi.cans. N.L. v. denitrifico to denitrify, N.L. part. adj. denitrificans denitrifying).
Cells are facultatively anaerobic, Gram-negative rods, 0.7 μm wide and 1.0–2.5 μm long, and motile with one polar flagellum.
Colonies are yellow and round with clear margins on R2A medium.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C (optimally at 30 °C), at pH 5.0–9.0 (optimally at pH 6.0–9.0) and with 0–1 % NaCl (w/v).
Hydrolyses Tween 80 and tyrosine, but not casein, chitin, DNA, hypoxanthine, pectin, starch or xanthine.

Positive for nitrate reduction, indole production and arginine dihydrolase, but negative for glucose fermentation, urease, aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase (API 20NE strips).

Assimilates d-glucose, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium gluconate, capric acid, malic acid, trisodium citrate, d-ribose, inositol, sodium acetate, lactic acid, l-alanine, l-serine, propionic acid, valeric acid, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybutyric acid and l-proline, but does not assimilate l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, maltose, adipic acid, phenylacetic acid, l-rhamnose, sucrose, itaconic acid, suberic acid, sodium malonate, potassium 5-ketogluconate, glycogen, 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, salicin, melibiose, l-fucose, d-sorbitol, potassium 2-ketogluconate or 4-hydroxybenzoic acid (API 20NE and API ID 32GN strips).
The major fatty acids are summed feature 3 (iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c) and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.0 mol%.
The type strain, 5YN1-3T (=KACC 12729T =DSM 21300T), was isolated from wetland peat in Yongneup, Korea.
